title: Identify and summarize the two primary qualitative factors that explain the largest year-over-year change in the T&D expense line item across FY 2023–2024 for Netflix, Inc. (NFLX)
description:
1. Identify qualitative factor #1: higher personnel-related costs.
  - The increase in T&D in FY 2024 (about $249.5M, or 9%) was primarily due to a $224 million increase in personnel-related costs. This represents roughly 90% of the total increase.
  - Cross‑check the pattern in interim 2024 filings: 
  - Q2 2024 10‑Q: Netflix's T&D expenses accelerated, growing 8% for the quarter and 5% for the first half of the year compared to the prior year. Management attributes these specific increases to corresponding rises in personnel-related costs: $43 million for the three months and $52 million for the six months.
  - Q3 2024 10‑Q: for the nine months ended September 30, T&D increased 7% year‑over‑year, which management explains as mainly due to a $122 million rise in personnel‑related costs, and the Q3 standalone increase (12% YoY) is similarly described as driven by a $70 million increase in personnel‑related costs. 
  - Taken together, this shows how throughout 2024, the dominant driver of T&D growth is Netflix’s higher personnel-related spending.
 
 2. Identify qualitative factor #2: increased general-use computer hardware/software.
  - As defined in the Q2 2024 10‑Q, the T&D expense includes general-use computer hardware/software.
  - In the Q2 2024 10‑Q, management states that the T&D increase for both the three and six months ended June 30, 2024 vs 2023 was driven not only by higher personnel-related costs but also by an increase in general‑use computer hardware expenses
  - The bulk of the FY 2023–2024 T&D (up $249.5M, +9%) increase is quantitatively driven by personnel costs, but the second key qualitative factor is higher spending on general-use hardware/software. This is the largest YoY change compared to the YoY change of FY 2022-2023 T&D (down about $35.3M, -1%).
answer: 1) A rise in personnel-related costs — roughly 90% of the $249.5M FY‑2024 vs FY‑2023 T&D increase. 2) Higher spending on general‑use computer hardware/software.

rubric.criteria: Recognizes that T&D expenses also include costs associated with general-use computer hardware and software.
Identifies the primary qualitative factor as a rise in personnel-related costs.
Notes that, per the same Q2 2024 10-Q, T&D expenses increased by about 5% year-over-year for the first half.
Notes that, per the Q2 2024 10-Q, T&D expenses increased by about 8% year-over-year for the quarter.
States that, per the Q2 2024 10-Q, the six-month T&D increase was primarily driven by higher personnel-related costs.
Quantifies that the Q2 2024 10-Q cites an approximate $52 million increase in personnel-related costs for the six-month period.
States that, per the Q2 2024 10-Q, the Q2 2024 T&D increase was primarily driven by higher personnel-related costs.
Quantifies that the Q2 2024 10-Q cites an approximate $43 million increase in personnel-related costs for the quarter.
States that, per the Q3 2024 10-Q, technology and development expenses for the nine months ended September 30, 2024 increased by about 7% year-over-year.
States that, per the Q3 2024 10-Q, the nine-month T&D increase was primarily driven by higher personnel-related costs.
Quantifies that the Q3 2024 10-Q cites an approximate $122 million increase in personnel-related costs for the nine-month period.
States that Q3 2024 standalone technology and development expenses increased by about 12% year-over-year.
States that, per the Q3 2024 10-Q, the Q3 2024 T&D increase was primarily driven by higher personnel-related costs.
Quantifies that the Q3 2024 10-Q cites an approximate $70 million increase in personnel-related costs for the quarter.
Identifies the second qualitative factor as increased spending on general-use computer hardware/software within T&D.
Approximately 90% of the $249.5M FY‑2024 vs FY‑2023 increase in T&D is attributable to personnel-related costs.
